snippet: Scott M. Stringer, a comptroller candidate, tried his hand at being a restaurateur in the 1990s, but the experience included bankruptcy and an acrimonious dispute with the landlord, records show.
abstract: Scott M Stringer, Manhattan borough president and candidate for city comptroller, once ran Uptown Local, a bar on the Upper West Side that closed after one year because of financial troubles; concedes that his youthful ambitions collided with a total lack of experience.

byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and MICHAEL BARBARO

lead_paragraph: Scott M. Stringer, a comptroller candidate, tried his hand at being a restaurateur in the 1990s, but the experience included bankruptcy and an acrimonious dispute with the landlord, records show.

headline.main: For Stringer, Stint as Barkeeper Proved Humbling
headline.print_headline: For Stringer, Stint as a Barkeeper Proved Humbling
